item.title: The Sims 4: Discord Lovestruck Quest Guide (Freezer Bunny Lovebug Avatar Decoration Reward)
item.description:
The Sims 4 is always expanding its game by releasing new Expansion Packs to keep players entertained with new and extensive content. In July 2024, the Lovestruck Expansion Pack was released, and it introduced many fun features. One of these features is the time-limited Discord quest, in which players complete a few steps in order to obtain a cute avatar decoration for their Discord profile called the Freezer Bunny Lovebug avatar.

Players only have a few days to complete the Lovestruck Quest. Luckily, it only takes a couple of minutes to finish. Having a Discord account is a must and those who don’t have one can create an account for free.

How To Complete The Sims 4 Discord Lovestruck Quest

The Sims 4 Discord Lovestruck quest is available from July 25 to July 30 (11:59 pm UTC) . Completing the quest rewards a cute Freezer Bunny Lovebug avatar as a profile decoration. To get it, you simply need to play The Sims 4 for 15 minutes and then claim the reward. Here's the full steps to earn the Freezer Bunny Lovebug avatar :

  • Create a Discord account if you don’t have one.
  • Open your desktop and log in to your Discord account using the app or browser.
  • Go to User Settings > Billing Settings > Gift Inventory.
  • Accept the Lovestruck Quest.
  • Open The Sims 4 .
  • Play the game for a minimum of 15 minutes.
  • Go back to the Gift Inventory in Discord.
  • Claim the Freezer Bunny Lovebug avatar.

Keep Discord open while you're playing your 15 minutes of The Sims 4 .

You can click Use Now to immediately activate the avatar or change it manually by heading to the Profiles section in the User Settings. Once the Freezer Bunny Lovebug avatar is live and moving, it will stay for 60 days before disappearing. If players finished the quest but haven’t redeemed the gift yet, make sure to claim the avatar before September 30, 2024 .

Once Simmers load into The Sims 4 , it’s not necessary to actually play the game as you can simply leave it running for 15 minutes, and it still counts towards the reward. Get out of the game temporarily to claim the Freezer Bunny Lovebug avatar and then continue playing or simply exit The Sims 4 and then claim the reward. Both methods work just fine.

If the quest doesn’t show up in the Gift Inventory, join the official The Sims Discord Server and try again. Players can do that by choosing the Explore Discoverable Servers option from the left side and searching for The Sims.

item.title: The Sims 4: How to Complete the Ring Bear Quest
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Find the Ring Bear
  • How to Complete the Ring Bear Quest
  • How to Reveal the Ring Bear's Identity

As players explore the world of Ciudad Enamorada in The Sims 4 's Lovestruck expansion pack, they will get to know its peculiar characters. Even though many of the inhabitants in Lovestruck's world are overjoyed and in love, there is one character that stands out due to their gloomy aura - the Ring Bear.

Gamers can talk to the Ring Bear and follow the information they give to solve an intriguing mystery. Completing this quest will grant players a unique reward, and this article will guide them through it.

How to Find the Ring Bear

To start the Ring Bear quest in The Sims 4 , players will have to locate the Ring Bear - a gloomy, blue bear who wanders around Ciudad Enamorada. The Ring Bear's location varies, but gamers will usually find him near the pond or river in Vista Hermosa or by the fountain in Plaza Mariposa . Talk to the Ring Bear and select the option "Ask about sadness" to initiate the quest.

How to Complete the Ring Bear Quest

Once players have asked the Ring Bear what caused their sadness, they will disclose that they are upset over the fact that they have lost a ring because they threw it in the pond in Vista Hermosa.

How to Find the Bear's Ring

To continue, gamers will have to visit the Vista Hermosa neighborhood in Ciudad Enamorada and fish in the pond until they catch the Ring Bear's ring. Next, players must return to the Ring Bear and question them about its strange markings in gnomish.

Where to Find the Fountain

The bear can't decipher the markings on the ring, but they do point in the direction of a fountain. To find the fountain, players must travel to Plaza Mariposa - it is located in the center of this neighborhood.

Once gamers have located the fountain, they have to select it and choose the "search fountain for clues" interaction. The fountain has similar markings but won't provide much information. Players will have to return to the Ring Bear and talk to them about what they've discovered.

Where to Find the Mural

The bear won't say much, as this subject brings up painful memories for them. However, they will reveal that the markings mention some sort of wall.

Gamers will have to visit the Mural, which is located besides the nightclub in Vista Hermosa . They must once again search it for clues. The Sim conducting the investigation will figure out that in order to activate the ring's magical powers, they simply have to rub it.

Rubbing the Ring Bear's magical ring will give the Sim the Ring Rizz moodlet , which lasts four hours, grants Sims +2 Confident mood, and boosts romantic social interactions.

Alternatively, players can sell the ring for 5,000 Simoleons, which can be quite handy for those who are in need of money or doing the Rags to Riches challenge.

How to Reveal the Ring Bear's Identity

Once players complete the Ring Bear's quest in The Sims 4 , they should continue to ask them for an explanation on why they're wearing a bear costume. If gamers have kept insisting on this matter throughout the quest, they will have some answer on why they wear it all the time. If not, they should find the Ring Bear once again and continue selecting the "bear costume explanation" interactions that appear .

While at first, the Ring Bear insists that they are a real bear, they'll eventually reveal that they're just a Sim underneath a costume. The Ring Bear, also known as Sammy García, was once in love and thought that was the meaning of life. This was up until their fiancé left them and returned their ring, leaving them heartbroken.

While Sammy strongly believes the ring is cursed and caused the downfall of their relationship, they continue to wear the bear outfit as it brings them comfort, as their mother used to dress up as a bear with them during a childhood phase.

After the " PLEAD for Bear Costume Explanation" interaction, Sammy García will finally reveal their identity and take off the blue bear costume .

item.title: Cookie Run Kingdom: Elder Faerie Cookie Build and Best Toppings
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Building Elder Faerie Cookie As The Shield
  • Cookie Run Kingdom: Toppings Build Guide for Elder Faerie Cookie
  • Optimizing Elder Faerie Cookie's Defensive Power

Adding new cookies in Cookie Run Kingdom is a matter of luck and the skill to acquire as many blue crystals as possible. Crystals are this gacha game's currency to pull new characters, taking 3,000 for one full pull of ten characters. While obtaining Epic, Super Epic, and Legendary cookies are not guaranteed, developer Devsisters does a phenomenal job with rewarding its player base for simply logging in and enjoying the game, making it incredibly easy to pull on multiple banners.

During the Cookie Laboratorium update (v5.2), Cookie Run Kingdom welcomed two new cookies to its roster. Matcha Cookie, the Magical Epic unit, and Elder Faerie Cookie, a Super Epic Defense-type cookie. Elder Faerie Cookie serves as Cookie Run Kingdom 's second Super Epic Defense unit, arriving after Crimson Coral Cookie. Once known as the ruler of the Faerie Kingdom, Elder Faerie Cookie also served as the Guardian of the Silver Tree's Seal of the Beast Cookies.

Building Elder Faerie Cookie As The Shield

Like most Defense units, Elder Faerie Cookie excels at fending off attacks with its high Defense and HP stats. These two categories make up most of Elder Faerie Cookie's combat power, though it does pack quite a punch if prepared correctly. With Crimson Coral Cookie also available, players will have two excellent options of Super Epic caliber, and Elder Faerie continues to be a viable option for new and experienced players alike.

Stats:

  • Guardian's Valor Sword DMG: 44.1% of summoner's Max HP
  • Guardian's Valor Explosion DMG: 123.2% of summoner's Max HP
  • Injury: Max HP -11.0% for 12.0 sec; capped at -25%
  • HP Healing: -30.0% for 12.0 sec; stacks up to x1
  • Taunt: 8.0 sec
  • HP Shield: 15.0% of target's Max HP for 7.0 sec + 1.5% per buff applied on Elder Faerie Cookie; capacity capped at 30.0%
  • Prism Shard Target: Cookie with the highest ATK x2 + x1 per Beascuit HP bonus effect
  • Prism Shards: x1 for 12.0 sec; negates all damage exceeding 10.0% of Cookie's Max HP at the expense of a charge
  • HP Healing: 2.0% of Max HP every 1 sec for 5 sec
  • DMG Resist: +15.0% for 12.0 sec; stacks up to x1
  • Passive: DMG Resist: +20.0% for 15.0 sec when receiving debuffs; stacks up to x2

Elder Faerie Cookie excels in multiple areas, from utilizing his high HP stat to maximize an explosive attack, to both defending and healing the party during times of need. While his healing ability doesn't match that of some of the best healers in Cookie Run Kingdom , it's still an excellent complimentary skill. His presence on the field, along with a powerful healer, will keep the entire team engaged in battle for the duration of the time limit.

Cookie Run Kingdom: Toppings Build Guide for Elder Faerie Cookie

Since players will want to keep Elder Faerie Cookie as healthy as possible, it only makes sense to put the most focus on his DMG Resist. For this reason, players should concentrate on building up Elder Faerie Cookie with Solid Almond toppings. The base stat increase for Solid Almonds is DMG Resist, and raising them up to Level 12 could run the possibility of earning a supplementary increase to DMG Resist with one of the sub stats.

Secondary stats that should be prioritized are Cooldown, HP, and DEF, in order to raise his already impressive strengths. Additionally, decreasing his Cooldown will aid with Elder Faerie Cookie launching constant skill attacks, which in turn will raise the shields for longer durations while offering some small heals along the way. With a Solid Almond build, Elder Faerie Cookie will rarely face defeat and keep his allies alive as well.

Optimizing Elder Faerie Cookie's Defensive Power

For players looking to draw out Elder Faerie Cookie's greatest potential, the details come in the description of its skill, Guardian's Valor. As per the skill's ability description, Elder Faerie Cookie grants a Prism Shard and applies a DMG Resist buff to himself, White Lily Cookie, and a Cookie with the highest ATK (or two Cookies with the highest ATK if White Lily Cookie is not in the team). Pairing Elder Faerie with White Lily and another high-offense cookie is worth consideration due to the sheer power of this skill.

Additionally, Beascuits are not something players can neglect when building their cookies. This accessory will grant additional boosts to individual types, focusing on the cookie's style of combat. Players can acquire Beascuits from the Beast-Yeast stages, which were released during the Secrets of the Silver Kingdom update (v.5.0). Unfortunately, acquiring the top-level Beascuits will require a team with a combat power of at least two million to compete and have a chance.

item.title: Sea of Thieves: How To Get The Burning Blade Ship (World Event Guide)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get The Burning Blade In Sea Of Thieves
  • Should You Sink The Burning Blade Or Pledge To Captain Flameheart?

Sea of Thieves Season 13 is your chance to become not just the villain, but the World Event by taking control of Captain Flameheart's flagship, the Burning Blade. It's the biggest and most powerful ship in Sea of Thieves yet, giving you control over a ship that's not only impervious to fire but capable of dishing out flames with the devastating Ashen Roar ability that shoots fireballs out the front of the monstrous vessel. If that wasn't enough, it's also got a whopping ten cannons and a dedicated Obsidian skeleton crew. Whether you're eager to take it on in battle to sink it or pledge your loyalty to Captain Flameheart, you'll likely want to know how to get the Burning Blade in Sea of Thieves .

Of course, there are a few things to know when taking on the Burning Blade and deciding whether to send it to the watery depths or whether to take control of the vessel yourself, each with its risks and potential for some big rewards.

How To Get The Burning Blade In Sea Of Thieves

The Burning Blade operates as a Sea of Thieves World Event, making it another of the open-world pirate game's random encounters that can appear on a server. A good start is to check your map table on your ship to see if any other players have control of the Burning Blade, which is marked by a large red ship on the map . Until taken by a player, it's controlled by a crew of Obsidian Skeletons. If controlled by other players, the marker will also have a Skeleton Camp icon beneath it.

To see if there's a Burning Blade world event active, check the horizon for thin red swirls in the sky emerging from the ship as pictured below. It's effectively a slimmer version of a fiery Ashen Lord tornado. If nothing seems to be active, you can try exiting the game and rejoining to to switch servers. Follow this marker in the sky to track down the Burning Blade.

Should You Sink The Burning Blade Or Pledge To Captain Flameheart?

On first encountering the Burning Blade, one of Sea of Thieves ' most impressive ships yet, an on-screen notification appears indicating if it's controlled by the Obsidian Skeleton crew. To take control of the Burning Blade, you must first defeat it in naval combat until it enters a defeated state . It's best to avoid its powerful flamethrower-style shots and keep peppering it with cannon fire to take it down.

Once defeated, it won't completely sink just yet but will pause for a short time in a defeated mode and give you another notification , as pictured below, plus dish out a yellow shockwave onto the waves. This gives you two choices: sink the Burning Blad e to reap to obtain the Blade of Souls, or board the ship and enter the captain's cabin to take control of it. Use your cannon to fire across to the ship for the best chance if taking control of it.

Board The Ship And Pledge To Flameheart

Once inside the Captain's cabin, you must vote on the captain's table in front of the statue of Flameheart to pledge to Captain Flameheart to take command of the ship before another crew potentially can. If done successfully, the Burning Blade is now your ship. By taking control of the ship, you are pledging your services to Captain Flameheart and your previous ship will sink. You'll also have an Obsidian skeleton crew sailing with you to help defend and maintain the ship.

From here, it's time to seek out Sea of Thieves ' Skeleton Camps in search of performing Rituals with the Orb of Secrets , so you can build Tribute and increase the Burning Blade's value . While there are only six Skeleton Camps in the world, there is no limit to how many you can complete as the crew of the Burning Blade. Completing Rituals also restores any Obsidian Skeletons that perish defending the ship. However, you'll need to keep the Burning Blade docked nearby to absorb the powers from the ritual. When you're ready, you can return the Burning Blade to Captain Flameheart at the Reaper's Hideout to conclude the World Event. Flameheart rewards you with gold and Reputation with the Reaper's Bones.

The more Rituals you complete, the bigger rewards you get, so the idea is to hold on to the Burning Blade for as long as possible. Anyone who hopes to take over the Burning Blade can only do so once and thereafter, it can only be sunk during that World Event. If it sinks, you also can't get it back.

Sink The Burning Blade

Alternatively, if you seek to oppose Captain Flameheart, you can sink the Burning Blade to receive the Blade of Souls . As the Burning Blade increases in value through completing Rituals, so does the Blade of Souls, a valuable Sea of Thieves weapon with fire properties. This means if you take down a player-controlled Burning Blade with a high number of Skeleton Camps completed, you'll get a bigger reward for sinking the Burning Blade and cashing in the Blade of Souls to one of the Sea of Thieves Trading Companies at an outpost for gold and Reputation .

Overall, there is a different mix of risk and reward whether you decide to pledge to Flameheart or sink the Burning Blade, so the choice is up to you.

item.title: 10 Best Soulslikes If You Want To Fight With Halberds
item.description:
Swords and shields are arguably the most ubiquitous armaments in the soulslike genre, but they're far from the only ones. Many fans will be looking for a heftier weapon with some more reach to it, and to that end, they'll likely seek out a halberd.

These bladed weapons combine the long reach of a spear with a heavy swing that's great for punishing enemies from a safe distance. This versatility generally requires a higher skill level, though. Halberds can be slow and tricky to wield, and without proper timing, wielders can open themselves up to a lot of pain. Here are some good soulslikes for trying out this lengthy weapon.

10 Lies of P

Reaching Across The Streets of Krat

The high-octane combat of Lies of P certainly favors swift, surgical strikes, but there are a few options for players who want something larger. The game's mix-and-match weapon crafting system lets players attach blades to different handles, some of which are ideal for two-handed combat.

Between longer handles like the City Longspear Handle and hefty blades like Cursed Knight's Halberd Blade, players can effectively craft their own halberds to use against the renegade puppets of Lies of P . Special weapons like the Azure Dragon Crescent Glaive and the Puppet Ripper offer ready-made halberds for players to use.

9 Demon's Souls

Standing Out In A Crowd

2020's Demon's Souls faithfully remade the FromSoft title that started it all. This includes the rich and varied weapons arsenal that would be a feature of many soulslikes to come. Polearms are just one of the many weapon types featured in the inaugural soulslike.

There are only five polearms in Demon's Souls , but this list includes a reliable halberd and a couple of scythes for flashier combat. These heavy weapons feature both wide sweeping blows and heavy thrusting attacks. These weapons might be slow, but they hit hard, and are excellent at dealing with crowds.

8 Salt and Sacrifice

A Grim 2D Ordeal

The 2D nature of Salt and Sacrifice and its predecessor set them apart from most of their fellow soulslikes. In many other ways, though, they take obvious inspiration from the Dark Souls trilogy and its ilk. This means that Salt and Sacrifice has a broad selection of weapons for players to choose from, including halberds.

Salt and Sacrifice features both glaives and halfspears, each of which represent iconic halberd properties in their own distinct ways. As one might expect, halfspears are a bit speedier than glaives, and are a good option for a more defensive style. Glaives, meanwhile, dish out much higher damage and have some excellent combos, but are quite a bit slower and thus riskier to use.

7 Dark Souls

Respect the Classics

The legendary Dark Souls almost singlehandedly invented the soulslike genre, and it has the genre hallmarks to back it up. The game's 22 weapon categories include a robust selection of nine halberds, including a few powerful boss weapons like the Gargoyle Halberd and the Lifehunt Scythe.

Halberds in Dark Souls are both powerful and versatile. They give players access to several damage types, including thrust, which makes them great for fighting in tight corridors. While they may be slower than spears, they make up for it in damage output, making them an excellent option for players who want to hit hard.

6 Nioh 2

Getting Tricky

The brutal Nioh 2 has a unique take on the halberd archetype. Instead of presenting traditional heavy glaives, this game features a weapon category called the Switchglaive. There are 22 different switchglaives for fans to find and use in Nioh 2 , and all of them present a distinct approach to combat.

As the name suggests, the switchglaive weapon class allows players to seamlessly shift between multiple weapon forms, presenting a combat style similar to the trick weapons from Bloodborne . Since they're still glaives at heart, though, many switchglaives have forms that offer excellent reach. They even boast a special attack that allows players to deflect projectiles.

5 Dark Souls 3

Swing for the Sweet Spot

The iconic Dark Souls 3 refined a lot of mechanics from its two predecessors. Unlike the first game, Dark Souls 3 splits halberds and scythes into two separate categories, giving them different mechanics and movesets. Fortunately for halberd fans, that still leaves 11 weapons in the prior category to play with.

As before, these weapons generally function as heavier, slower spears, but they also have some vicious slashing moves to give them more variety. They excel at reach, but if an enemy closes in tight, players might be better off switching away. Notably, halberds in Dark Souls 3 have a sweet spot mechanic: if a player lands a hit just right, they'll get some bonus damage.

4 Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty

Getting In Some Wild Strikes

Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty , a historical fantasy set in the Three Kingdoms period of Ancient China, has a remarkable approach to its halberd weapons. The basic halberd category includes just three weapons, and they function about as one would expect, offering excellent reach and solid defensive capabilities.

Uniquely, however, the game also has a category for dual halberds. There are four matched sets of halberds for players to collect, and these play differently from the standard halberd archetype. They favor high mobility and long combos, and are excellent at mowing down groups of foes.

3 Dark Souls 2

Squaring Up

The infamous Dark Souls 2 made a lot of changes to the series' combat formula, but one thing that didn't change was the variety of weapons. Like its predecessor, Dark Souls 2 has a hefty selection of halberds, with fourteen of them available to players. This doesn't count scythes, which Dark Souls 2 split into a different category.

Like the other games in the trilogy, halberds are capable of heavy swings that can cut down a lot of enemies at once. Some of them can also be thrust forward like a spear, albeit a slower and heavier one. In true Dark Souls fashion, these spear-like halberds can be used while maintaining a shield guard, making them an excellent choice for defensive players.

2 Lords of the Fallen

Carrying A Big Stick

Lords of the Fallen , like the Dark Souls games that inspired it, has a healthy variety of halberds for players to use. The polearm weapon category boasts fourteen distinct weapons for players to acquire over the course of their adventure. This includes not only basic halberds, but also bladed staves and strange weapons like the Abbess Staff.

Poleaxes and halberds in Lords of the Fallen excel at reach, and are ideal for dealing with foes from a safe distance. They do suffer at closer range, but with the help of the game's unique weapon rune mechanic, players can customize and craft a polearm they can truly be proud of.

1 Elden Ring

Stabbing On Top Of The World

It might be a long time before another soulslike is able to rival Elden Ring for the depth and breadth of its weapon library. The Lands Between and the Realm of Shadow are bristling with weapons of every type one can imagine, and this includes a blistering eighteen halberds. Like all the weapons in Elden Ring , these halberds have a fully realized moveset and can be freely customized with the game's many Ashes of War.

If players want to go for an even heavier reach weapon than the halberd, Elden Ring also offers the Great Spear category. These ten weapons incorporate the heavy thrusting techniques of halberds and spears alike, taking this playstyle to the extreme with its brutality.
